meanings.sent1: The scaups swam gracefully in the pond.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of scaups diving for food in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The scaups played a game of hide and seek among the lily pads.
meanings.sent4: The scaups dove into the water like synchronized swimmers.
meanings.sent5: The colorful scaups stood out against the calm water.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'scaup', referring to multiple diving ducks.
meanings.sent1: We counted ten scaups on the lake today.
meanings.sent2: The scaups quacked loudly as they paddled together.
meanings.sent3: The scaups waddled awkwardly on the shore, trying to stay in line.
meanings.sent4: The sky was filled with a flock of scaups, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The group of scaups created ripples in the water as they swam.
